website_summaries.verdict: Bounce-free yet comfortable, this hydration waistpack can hold most of what a runner needs without being encumbered with too many features.
pros: Main pocket can fit larger-format phones, even with hardshell cases
Additional strap helps secure bottles in holders
Bib holders work well, keeping race bibs in place and in one piece
cons: Mesh bottle holders aren’t rigid, making it difficult to put bottles back in place
Thinner users may have trouble adjusting belt to fit snugly

customer_reviews.title: Too large for 5'10 150lb, flops all around.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 32 waist and it barely gets small enough so it doesn't ride up or bounce around too bad once you get some sweat on it. Before it's sweaty, however, it flies all over the place. It is much to large to wear around my stomach/mid torso even on the smallest setting. Going to get a vest-style instead. Seems to be of nice quality, however. I could hold my phone, car key, and one block gel pack and still be able to remove my phone easily.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L. Lakes

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay on hips
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’4, 145 and do Crossfit and half marathons religiously. I wanted an option to make my twice weekly long runs in Texas tolerable and unfortunately this just wasn’t it. Fully tightened, the belt slid down my hips two feet into the fist run. I ended up wearing it across my chest so it fit under one arm and surprisingly it wasn’t bad but given it’s 110 right now, I was desperate. The water bottles leaked some but not bad. This belt might work for someone with more butt to hold it up, I just didn’t have it. I’ll likely bite the bullet and grab a Nathan’s hydration vest.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Bring it!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. I was skeptical at first, but after first use I was surprised to find out it was exactly what I needed. It was just as described. My iPhone 6 Plus fit perfectly in the pocket with the case on. Definitely would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will keep it brief, the bottles are of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Will keep it brief, the bottles are of the 10oz variety, lightweight and fit snugly in the pockets as there is a small elastic band that keeps them from falling. The bottles are also spillproof as they have the locking nozzle. The elastic is very well designed and well adjustable. The pocket is decent sized and holds my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 with a fairly bulky case without issues. I also tried fitting 2 phones, my Note 3 and also my girlfriend's Note 5 with the mophie power case - was a very tight fit but was able to get it in.
customer_reviews.author: kevin374

customer_reviews.title: Big girl loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I'm 5'8 and 217 lbs, I started running 2 weeks ago and this has been a life saver. It fits very well, I wear it a little higher on my "natural waist" aka where my fatrolls come together, and it stays there. It's super handy and fits my Samsung s6 perfectly which leaves room for other things (like pepper spray). Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anouschka Glunt

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my former belt that I have somehow lost. I like this one just fine. I don't use the bottles that came with it, preferring my own 1/2 liter bottles that provide more hydration than the 10 oz bottles that were supplied. The zipper compartment is ok, but a little small. It does fit an extra charger in case I need to recharge my phone or a little supply of dog biscuits that I carry to give to "make friends" with neighborhood dogs! I walk 8-10 miles a day so having a little more space to carry "stuff" would be better but this works out fine. All in all, I'm happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have an Lg3 cell phone which is humongous lol and it fits perfectly. I also carry a key and my asthma inhaler. Perfect. The bottles don't bounce around and they're really convenient to get to and to put them back in the pouch while I'm running.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great value but not for waist size less than 32
customer_reviews.text: This belt is a great value and a very comfortable fit for me. My waist size is between 32 and 33, and if I were any smaller this belt would probably be a bit too loose. The bottles are a good size and work well -- probably enough hydration for a half marathon, but not enough for much longer, at least for me. I bought this to replace an older model "Fuel Belt" brand and so far this seems to be comparable quality for a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: John Brown

customer_reviews.title: Runners need this belt
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product but for me I have to wear it on my back side. My arms were hitting the bottles when running. Very light weight and does not move around. The bottles stay secure while running. No bouncing around. I almost forget I am wearing it. The only negative is that the bottles stain easily. I added BCA's before my last half marathon and it turned the inside of the bottles pink. Other than that this is a fantastic product
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Great running belt with 2x300 ml bottles and big pocket
customer_reviews.text: Great belt. 2x300 ml (2x10 oz) bottles. Fits perfectly my Galaxy S10+, the credit card, ID, car key (I put it in vertical position on one extreme) and a small snack. My waist is 34" and the belt could go down to 32" as I use it. A skinnier person should have to unpick the end of the strap and then sew it again and reduce up to 3 inches each side. But if it is too much shorten the bottles could interfere with arm movement.
customer_reviews.author: GGR

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw for running
customer_reviews.text: Because of the stretch in the elastic waist band it won’t stay around my waist while running. The bouncing motion of running causes the elastic to stretch and then it just slips on down your legs. Even with the waist band tightened all the way it wouldn’t stay in place unless I half emptied the water bottles to reduce their weight dragging the belt down. I only had to run a block or two before it was around my legs. Sadly, for me it is worthless. For walkers though or maybe people with large waists it might be very good as it is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Toxic Avenger

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for small people
customer_reviews.text: It says it's adjustable, but small-waisted people, beware. The pouch in the middle is quite big so both water bottles are on the edge of your hips, no matter which way you wear it. (I'm a size 0.) I could adjust it down and it sat fine, seemed comfortable, but there is no way to wear it without your arms hitting the water bottles. I returned it and got a Nathan Switchblade and I'm very happy with that so far.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit surprised by all the positive reviews of this product. It works reasonably well with one full bottle cannot get it tight enough to run with two (35 inch waist). All that being said the biggest issue is with the bottles. After the first use the bottle began to turn yellow and started off gassing. I have soaked the bottles, run them through the dishwasher several times and no matter what I did to them after holding water for 15-20 min the water in the bottle is undrinkable. There are no resin markings on the bottle So hard to know what the issue is with the plastic. Save your money lots of other options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: No movement!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new hydration belt because the 7 year old Nathan belt I had couldn't hold the new smart phones. It was overdue for retirement. I'm very pleased that this belt moves even less than my old one. It's light, fits snug, and has ample room for my S7 edge with an otterbox and headphone jack. Definitely recommend. Note - I wear a size 4 pant (USA) and I have the belt adjustment almost as tight as it will go. Any woman who wears a pant size smaller than a 2 may have issues with getting it tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Miska

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the marathon runner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my marathon runner husband 's old running belt. I'm not really familiar with these belts but my husband went on and on about how great it was and that it's so much better than his old belt. Bigger bottles, more room, more comfortable fit. These are some of the comments I remember him saying about this belt. He loves it, I look like a pretty great wife and that's exactly what I was looking for. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CindyW

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend a smaller framed person buying this
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for awhile and finally just got around to using it. I would not recommend a smaller framed person buying this. I'm a size 2 and with the belt taken in all the way in it still bounces a lot during a run. Also, could have been a fluke, but the water bottles leak horribly.
customer_reviews.author: DM467

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Gave it a Try!!!
customer_reviews.text: If this review were solely about the company, there are just not enough stars available. There was a problem with my initial ordered and they knocked customer service out of the park!! I bought the belt and used it for the first time this weekend! Loved it. The pocket fit my iPhone 6s (in it’s case), my glasses, credit card license, $20 and the headphone were accessible. The dual water bottles stayed snuggly in their holsters and gave me a more even feel while running. No big water bottle bouncing about! The belt was comfortable and stayed dry yet I didn’t feel extra sweaty where it sat around my waist. Pleased and will go back to this company again! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: I love this belt
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt! I bought it to start training for a half marathon during the summer. I have used it on every outdoor run and hike for the last 4-5 months. I have an Iphone 6 plus and its a bit snug with head phone pugged in but it still zips up and its not a pain to get out. I have not had any issues with the belt moving around or riding up. The bottle sizes are perfect... not too big but gives you enough to keep you hydrated (or cooled off if need be). Highly recommend for anyone going out for a walk, run, or hike.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Lewter

customer_reviews.title: Good to go!
customer_reviews.text: I like it and I don't like running with anything. I have an iPhone 6s in an otter box and I can make it fit but took case off when I put it in on a run. Use blue tooth earbuds so can't comment to that... My pant waist size is 38-40" and had more than enough room for bigger or smaller. Construction good, don't see any problems or potential for issues. This company sent me emails to let me know it shipped and asked that if I contact a certain person if any problems. They followed up to make sure I was happy. Wow! I recommend it and would buy again, I will buy from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized pocket!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this belt a few times but I love it! I bought it because I plan to do my first half marathon this year and needed something that would hold both water and my monster of a phone. Other belts have too small a pocket. This was perfect and the yellow zipper/neoprene material sold it for me (I love yellow and needed something waterproof). Happy running!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure if this would be a good belt bc the price is lower than what I ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if this would be a good belt bc the price is lower than what I have seen in running stores. I have used it for 4 runs now and I love it. I use one bottle for water and one for recovery drink. The bottles are easy to use while running. The pocket fits my iPhone 6s as well as a gel pack. Once I adjusted the straps properly, which was very easy, the belt sits in place without jiggling during my run. I'm so glad I got this belt and didn't spend 3x as much on a name brand I recognized at a boutique running store.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect answer to the longer runs in hot weather!
customer_reviews.text: Wore it for the first time for a 6K today. It's secure on my hips and holds my keys, phone, tissues, etc. only took one or two tries to become an expert at getting the water bottles in and out. I'm sure I will get tons of use from this in the hot summer months and for longer runs. Thanks for this great product!
customer_reviews.author: Penneilmom

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to using your pockets
customer_reviews.text: I go for a 2 mile walk/jog about 3 times a week; I used to have to carry my water bottle on one hand and my iPhone 6 Plus on my pocket. My phone would flap around on my shorts pocket and the water would get warm really quick. This belt has solved both issues. It stays in place and it surprisingly comfortable to wear. One my concerns was that it would slide down during my jogging, but the material (I believe it's silicone) keeps it well in place. I ended up buying 2; one for me and one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: isisyodin

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in July so I would be able to run and workout with my phone, water, and identification securely attached. I have been running 4 miles 3x week and it has been satisfactory. I have washed it and let it air dry. Just finished running and noticed it starting to rip. It has not been 3months and this product is falling apart. Now I have to sew the belt or replace it. NO GOOD!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior!
customer_reviews.text: This belt is outstanding! I have tried so many to use for my running workouts and all have failed miserably. Either the bottles were too small or the belt was not strong enough to hold up a large cell phone. I own an iPhone 6 Plus and the phone fits perfectly. The bottles are a good size and an ample amount for a 5 or 10k run/walk. There is not much bounce and the belt feels secure. It has what I need to fit the bill! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Bad Zipper Placement
customer_reviews.text: I've used a competing brand, Fuel Belt, since 2008. The Fuel Belt has four bottles, one small pouch, and one large pouch. I use the small pouch for goo packs and the large for cell phone and id. I don't like the velcro fastener of the Fuel Belt. Bought the Bringit Hydration Belt to replace the Fuel Belt. What I like: snap fastener, running bib ties, sturdy construction What I do not like: the horizontal zipper is centered on the pouch. The zipper should be at or near the top for me anyway. I fumble around trying to get my iPhone 5s in/out. It's an issue if I have jam three or four goo packs in the pouch too.
customer_reviews.author: Thorium

customer_reviews.title: good. decent. pouch is too small due to zipper height.
customer_reviews.text: Good: 2- 10oz bottles tighten enough for 32 waist want it slightly more tighten if it could. Bad: the zipper is in the middle so you can't put a lot in the pouch. If you put your phone in then it would take most of the space. bottom's height is 1 GU energy gel landscape.
customer_reviews.author: alansunshine

customer_reviews.title: Super running belt
customer_reviews.text: I use this belt for walking exercise. It is precisely what I was looking for. It has an adequate size compartment, 2 water bottles and is very comfortable. Also, it is a plus for me that it does not bulge out put hugs the body.
customer_reviews.author: ThosRM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long runs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is training for the Los Angeles marathon. He’s up to seventeen miles (yay!). He needed a lightweight belt to hold his Gatorade, Gu, phone and other necessities. I hesitated buying this for him because he’s a bit particular but he took it on his last long run and he loved it. He said he could hardly feel it, it didn’t move around a lot and it was the perfect size for carrying all his stuff. It met all his needs, he had no complaints and for that I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much bought a second one for my husband
customer_reviews.text: This belt is very comfortably, it’s not hot (and I use it during hot Caribbean runs) I can fit my keys, phone, money ID I have even carried a chap stick by mistake (forgot to take it out beforehand). I especially like that it doesn’t have part of the belt hanging while I run.
customer_reviews.author: Irmes

customer_reviews.title: The phone pouch is perfect. Large enough and workable
customer_reviews.text: Used the Hydration belt at my most recent run and here's my opinion. The phone pouch is perfect. Large enough and workable. The engineering of the fluid containers is good but the fluid containers are not large. I used every drop for a half-marathon. I wish they held a little more fluid. I did like how the belt fit. I do wish it had a key pouch (although it does have a separate pouch in the phone area-that is not very efficient as it makes my phone push out and "thickens" the pouch. Would I recommend it to a long distance runner in training? For the price-yes. It does answer several issues.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good belt, bad bottles
customer_reviews.text: I like the belt. It's better than my previous one. But I'm using the bottles from my old belt. Neither of the ones that came with this belt work correctly, and they are so tall they are annoying. But with my old bottles, the belt works great. It's comfortable and keeps the bottles securely in place. I also like the "grip" pads to keep the belt in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bettie W

customer_reviews.title: Great belt, great value
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to try this belt because I thought it would be bulky or that it would slide down and be annoying to keep fixing. Im so glad I gave it a try because it is very comfortable and since it has grips on the inside it stays put for my whole run. It gets the job done if you need to carry water with you. I use the pocket for my key fob... And occasionally for my phone too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just for serious runners!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a marathon runner, but I am running with my older daughter and jogging/walking with my little one. Sometimes we finish our laps and stay at the park for ahwile so it's nice to not have to carry something to make sure everyone stays hydrated. Having 2 bottles of water is great for all of us. I have a Galaxy Note 8 with a case (not super bulky otterbox) and I can squeeze it in the front pocket. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: aporch

customer_reviews.title: I like this belt
customer_reviews.text: I like this belt. this is my second one. I've been using the first for 3-4 years but the water bottle pocket has ripped at the seam so its time for a new one. My wife's used it also but complained that she hits the bottles with her elbows while running. the pockets plenty big enough for my Galaxy S7 edge
customer_reviews.author: Matty B

customer_reviews.title: Sweet belt
customer_reviews.text: Great hydration belr. Very soft and stretchable. Love the dotted rubber backing on the two insides. This helps to keep the belt in place when moving around. The bottles are large enough to hold plenty of water, easily removed and easy to drink from. Love the toggles for race bibs, also. The center compartment is large enough to hold my Samsung Galaxy phone, keys, a bar, tissues, etc. Reflective, sturdy, and good looking. The price is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. I can just barely squeeze some energy chews in with my phone, and I love having 20 oz of water at hand. Great for 5-13 miles, I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F

customer_reviews.title: Works but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would be a little more water resistant. It worked well enough though. Belt stretched out a bit with water and was bouncing up and down on the tightest setting. Would have preferred a little better quality. Used for a Spartan Super (9.2 miles, through rain, mud, and obstacles).
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: The ear bud cord hole worked great as well
customer_reviews.text: Ran with this once and I'm very impressed. I was wearing a hydration pack, but this is much more manageable. The belt stays in place with no problems. A bit challenging to get the iPhone 6plus in and out, especially while you are running, but I also had my keys, salt tabs and a couple of gel packs in there. The ear bud cord hole worked great as well. The water bottles fit in your hand very well and were easy to access. Highly recommend this belt if you're looking for a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D.

customer_reviews.title: but it is easy to readjust and overall was comfortable for the whole ...
customer_reviews.text: Used the belt on a 17 mile run this week. Belt fits very well and seems to be well made but it did start to get loose and move every 5 or 6 miles, but it is easy to readjust and overall was comfortable for the whole run. Bottles are a little hard to put back into their spot but not that bad. Overall it seems to be a great belt so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Could use bigger bottles
customer_reviews.text: The unit is great but I would like to see slightly bigger bottles, maybe 12 ounces instead of 10 and making the pouch a bit bigger to handle more than just one object. I use an iPod to listen to music with not my phone and this pouch can't handle both a phone and the iPod.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Miller

customer_reviews.title: BRINGIT! is the perfect running belt.
customer_reviews.text: BRINGIT is the perfect running belt. I have several others but they do not provide all the functionality that this one does. I can now go on longer runs with my phone, car key, and water. The pouch is plenty big but not overly so. I have been using this for about 2 weeks now and I love it. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: All2sweet

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt. I love the material and really like how secure it feels. I was super impressed when I received it. If you plan to run outside and want something comfortable I would totally go with this belt.
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: High quality perfect✅
customer_reviews.text: Love the Brinigit hydration belt✅✅✅ Received it fast and live the comfort on my waist with the zip pocket and internal pocket to keep from scratching my iphone East to grab the bottles. Good price High quality 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: KatWPitts

customer_reviews.title: Great belt at a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice running belt with plenty of space for your big phone which is made conveniently accessible. If the water bottles had 2oz more apiece that would be great for me as I use one for me and one for my dog when we run together. That said, I can make do with this setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kimba

customer_reviews.title: Was too big for me to the point where it ...
customer_reviews.text: Was too big for me to the point where it was on its tightest and after running a few miles it would loosen up again. In the end it gave me chaffing and I have a scar on my waist near my spine. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fitting belt, but one of the bottle leaks
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I was about to use this for my first long run today, and one of the bottle leaks from the bottom. So, I am only giving this 3 stars, as I do like the way this fits. I am going to contact customer service to see if they will send me a free bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: fits so great
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using a Lululemon fanny pack to run and it was always moving all over the place. this belt is awesome. functional with 2 waters but the best part is it stays put. awesome material.
customer_reviews.author: syl_rod_canada

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration belt for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just wore my new hydration belt for a half marathon yesterday, and I was really pleased with it. Very comfortable, stayed in place, water bottles didn't get in the way of my arm swing (I'm a walker). I have a Galaxy S5, and the fit was a bit tight - a little cumbersome wrestling it in and out of the pocket, but much preferred to wearing it on my arm or in a jacket pocket. I washed the bottles with hot, soapy water and didn't have any issues with taste/smell, as some reviews mentioned. Overall, for the price, totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: L. K.

customer_reviews.title: This is the right choice!
customer_reviews.text: I took a little time reviewing all the different models offered here on Amazon and I definitely made the right choice! Some are 6 oz bottles, this is 10. This easily holds my iPhone 6S plus an energy bar. Plus an easy routing for my earbuds! And yes, as it says, there's really no bounce with full water bottles! This is the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: So I've used this about 15 times already and have mostly used it for walking and it's really good quality and front pocket holds a lot but I noticed when I swing my arms they hit the water bottles. So I have to adjust the belt and move it to the sides. I also used on bike ride and had to move water bottles in back so it was more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Recruiter

customer_reviews.title: Good product but all you could want in a sport carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son and he uses it daily. There is only one thing it at it’s smallest is to big. But a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This running belt was lightweight and did the job perfectly. I wore it with the water bottles behind during my Ragnar trail race. It was just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... of these for my wife for Christmas and she loved it so much I had to have one for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for my wife for Christmas and she loved it so much I had to have one for myself. It's comfortable, the bottles don't bounce, and it fits my iPhone 6 Plus (with a slim case, or case-less, but not with a larger case on it). Great product.
customer_reviews.author: anakronistical

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use on every run.
customer_reviews.text: Have to take my iPhone 6s out of it case to put in carrier.
customer_reviews.author: john n.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love the pocket and the material. Very comfy and effective. My only thing is that I’m pretty petite so it’s a little big on me. I used some chip clips to hold it to my size but other than that I like it
customer_reviews.author: Cami C.

customer_reviews.title: I've never had a belt before and I was happy with it when I took it out for an ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this once and was able to fit in my iPhone 6S with an otter box cover. It is tight, but works. I've never had a belt before and I was happy with it when I took it out for an 8 mile run. I plan on using it for my first 1/2 next month and don't see any issues. There was no leaking and it didn't bounce.
customer_reviews.author: gallerygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as described. It is comfortable and of good quality. If I had to pick one thing to change I wish the zippered pocket was a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Reichelt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well designed running hydration belt
customer_reviews.text: This hydration belt is so comfortable and stays put very well. Unlike most belts you do not even realize its on you. The bottle design to latch them in place is great and the front pouch holds iPhone 6S perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: ANDY HECK

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is annoying
customer_reviews.text: I got this belt because a previous one I ordered barely fit my phone so it was hard to get in and out. This belt fits my phone but the zipper in the middle of the pouch makes it just as hard to get the phone in and out. I don't get the point of having a sipper in the middle of the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: sl

customer_reviews.title: This is really comfortable. It fits my iPhone 6 and my keys
customer_reviews.text: This is really comfortable. It fits my iPhone 6 and my keys. It would be useful if the bottle holders were stiffer, but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Bottles are garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The belt is decent for running with a lightweight feel and plenty of room for a phone, car key, and a gel or two. However, the water bottles are hot garbage. Both caps broke and leaked during their first use. Ultimately I currently have a $25 fanny pack.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could use a bit more room in the pocket.
customer_reviews.text: I carry tissues, money, key, phone, emergency info--would be nice if the main pocket had a bit more room, but the belt fits well, stays tight.
customer_reviews.author: ydsak

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this pack and will recommend it to all runners
customer_reviews.text: Ran a half marathon yesterday using this pack. My race day pack holds a package of Trial Size Wet One's, Advil in the foil packet, GU pack, id, money, and my iphone 6. Even though the pack is a little heavier with the 10 oz bottles when they are full, I actually prefer having a little bit more water/gatorade on my runs. Absolutely love this pack and will recommend it to all runners.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Hainey

customer_reviews.title: Great for long runs/races
customer_reviews.text: I was able to carry the amount of fluid i needed for a 1/2 Marathon -i like the 10oz bottles for runs this long-Much better than the 6oz bottles
customer_reviews.author: jst

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for larger phone with separate pockets for keys/gels.
customer_reviews.text: I don't run without my phone and since switching to iPhone 6s Plus, I've had to leave my phone...once(I forced it into another carrier or put in ziploc). That was all it took for me to search out a new way to carry it. I like this belt because my phone fits and I have a separate spot for keys, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel E Stewart

customer_reviews.title: A good belt for running
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this belt at first, but now after several runs I enjoy it way more than my previous belt. It holds my phone and ID with room to spare. The 20oz of water ensures I have plenty to drink on my longer runs. I'll update this review as I stack on the mileage. In all, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DrIndyJones

customer_reviews.title: This is the best Fuel Belt
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Fuel Belt, the holy grail of fuel belts. I ripped up and junked my old fuel belt immediately. I ran 13 miles the other day and I hardly knew I was wearing the belt, the water bottles stayed in place, there was no chaffing, and it fit like a perfect glove. I love this thing and will always appreciate it, especially during my 20+ mile runs for my marathon training. Enjoy it! Thanks, BRINGIT. You're the best! Brian
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The belt is nice, light
customer_reviews.text: The belt is nice, light, stretchy and molds to your body but the water bottles caps don't screw on good and water leaks and I wish the zipper for the pocket was at the top, it's a pain to put your phone in there if you have it in a case
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent belt
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Holds my iPhone 7 Plus without a cover. Large beverage containers. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rickw262

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, pouch could be a little bigger for larger phones and long runs needing more supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Best choice ever!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 1st half marathon and I am so glad that I chose this one. I also purchased 1 for my husband as well. We both thought it was very usefull. The pocket was big enough for my samsung s6 and 2 panty liners and 4 tampax and there was still room. I thought it would be heavy with the water and everything in it, but it was still very comfortable to wear and did not bother me once during the race.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to race belt!
customer_reviews.text: This belt was so comfortable, had plenty of space for my needs and the hydration bottles were just the size. I am so glad I purchased this product. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great belt for running
customer_reviews.text: This is a great belt for running. It holds the iPhone 7plus easily and does not bounce while running. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MegandTorin

customer_reviews.title: The elastic is not very durable - mine has started ...
customer_reviews.text: The elastic is not very durable - mine has started to come apart after only a few runs. The belt tends to bounce a lot, which can cause it to migrate down your hips slowly. Pouch is well built however, and just fits an iPhone 6s+.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Clements

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Bottle don't bounce and strap is wide enough to be comfortable, even for very long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Burl Hays

customer_reviews.title: Bad Plastic smell/taste
customer_reviews.text: Belt is a great fit, but I cannot get rid of the chinese toxic plastic smell/taste from the belt and bottles. Its been a week:-(
customer_reviews.author: MRed

customer_reviews.title: I am definitely happy with this
customer_reviews.text: The dog ate my fuel belt. I did not want to spend that much money a new one. I saw this, and saw that it also holds and iphone 6 plus-bonus! The bottles hold more than the fuel belt bottles. And it includes the race bib holder. I am definitely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: So confortable! I can take my cellphone and earpods and I can be hydrated during my rollerblading workout! Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Castro

customer_reviews.title: Just ran a half marathon with it and love it so much
customer_reviews.text: Just ran a half marathon with it and love it so much. So useful for keeping my energy bars and gels in and the water bottles are easy in and out so I don't have to break stride to hydrate.
customer_reviews.author: kellyq

customer_reviews.title: Was doubtful but lived it!
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't like to have anything around my waist when I run because they would always ride up and cause chaffing but after doing a 17 mile run in the heat w/o water I realized it needed something. I read the reviews old decided to give it a try. I loved it!!!! It stayed put and didn't ride up and I didn't even feel like I had it on and it was easy to access the water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter belt
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and feel of the belt however when trying to re holster the water bottles it proves to be very difficult when running. The elastic is very tight around the bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: It was PERFECT! It did not shake or move while I ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim for running a half marathon. It was PERFECT! It did not shake or move while I was running. The bottles were easy to remove and I love that there was a spot on the outside for my GU, that way I didn't have to try and unzip the pouch. My Samsung Galazy S5 fit perfect and without a hassle. Very happy I made this purchase, I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Bowerson

customer_reviews.title: Great running belt!!
customer_reviews.text: A comfortable running belt that holds phone and keys as well as keeping you hydrated with two water bottles!!
customer_reviews.author: Rita B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Not too heavy and holds my iPhone 6 that's in a large battery case
customer_reviews.author: J. Wags

customer_reviews.title: This belt is great! It wasn't heavy even with the two water ...
customer_reviews.text: This belt is great! It wasn't heavy even with the two water bottles filled. I could fit an S5 with otterbox cover, ear buds, ID (in an separate interior pocket) and energy gels. I agree with other reviews that the zipper placement may be nicer if located at the top, but I had no issues. The belt did not ride up while running. It was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Griffith

customer_reviews.title: It stays in place and does not move during a run so it stays comfortable. Pocket is sized well for bigger phones
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice so far and am getting used to it. It stays in place and does not move during a run so it stays comfortable. Pocket is sized well for bigger phones. It takes a little getting used to replacing water bottles after use with one hand but has gotten easier with each use.
customer_reviews.author: John  Wanner, mr

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration belt for long runs
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lightweight, bottles are perfect size, super comfortable fit, two pockets inside the big pocket, fits my iPhone 6plus including its case, strings to attach running bibs if you'd like. Cons: No outlet for earphones if you put your phone in the pocket (no hole).
customer_reviews.author: Noemi Soto

customer_reviews.title: 1st marathon...
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. Training for my first marathon and plan to wear the belt during the event. I wear the belt on most of my short runs and all of my long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah u.s.

customer_reviews.title: I have a 32" waste, and at the belt's tightest fit it was ...
customer_reviews.text: First Impression (9 mile run): I have a 32" waste, and at the belt's tightest fit it was still fairly loose, which caused a fair amount of bounce and slippage. The pocket was just able to fit my iPhone, one goo packet, a $20 bill, and a key fob... Overall, product works as advertised, runs a little big, looking forward to this weekend's long run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Terrific gadget to have while you run. Perfect fit and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Manoj Methil

customer_reviews.title: ... inch waist and the water bottles that still tastes like plastic when full have the belt flopping all over ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a men's 32 inch waist and the water bottles that still tastes like plastic when full have the belt flopping all over when I run. It fits my Samsung Galaxy S5 nicely but I would not recommend this item for an avid Runner with a narrow waist
customer_reviews.author: stephen tremblay

customer_reviews.title: Let's GO
customer_reviews.text: I love my new running belt. I put my phone which was why I bought it and I'm off running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Used it for the first time on an 8 mile run. Stayed put throughout the duration of my run and it comfortably fit my droid turbo with case, house key, ID cards and some cash. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David VanDerveer

customer_reviews.title: Good product works great with the iPhone 6 Plus it ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product works great with the iPhone 6 Plus it tends to move when ussing it in the back but works great in front
customer_reviews.author: Brais F.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and stays in place. Room for iPhone 6s with a protective. Bottles don't leak. I agree that the zipper would be better on the top, instead of the side, but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: running belt
customer_reviews.text: it feels comfortable, i only wear one water bottle so it doesn't feel chunky, the phone area is a little snug but that's only because i have blue tooth headset and need to take mu phone out to skip a song but thats pretty rare. Haven't had it that long but all in all it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: D. Teal

customer_reviews.title: Great belt!
customer_reviews.text: The belt is comfortable and doors tight on my hip bones. It doesn't bobble around or leak. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically write lots of reviews, but these guys sent me three requests for a review. This belt is just ok. The belt is so wide my arms rub the bottles when I am running. I ended up spinning it so one bottle is in the front and one in the back. While the pocket fits my iPhone 6plus, because the zipper is in the middle it is not easy to get in or out on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome belt
customer_reviews.text: This belt is extremely easy to use and delivery was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Running Belt with Water Bottles | Running Hydration Belt has Water Resistant Waist Pack to Fit iPhone, Samsung, Android, etc | Adjustable Belt | 10oz Bottles | Attach Race Number | Hiking & Cycling
product_meta.description:
The high quality BRINGIT running belt is built for comfort and durability. The water- resistant neoprene pocket is 7.5” long and 4” tall and will hold ALL smartphones including the iPhone 6 Plus and other smartphone brands & models. Additionally, there are interior pockets to store your driver’s license and a credit card. Use the pocket to fit keys, gel fuels, and/or sunglasses. The high quality zipper will secure your valuables and also give you easy access to your items. 

 The two 10 OZ plastic water bottles with pull tops will provide more water than the many models that only have 6 OZ bottles. They are secured in the bottle holders with a loop strap. The water-resistant neoprene water bottle pockets also have a reflective paint strip AND there are two more reflective tags on the side of each pocket. A total of four reflective tags and two reflective paint strips assist in your safety.

 The interior surface of the belt has gel-activated bumps that increase comfort and grip while reducing bounce and chafe while you run, cycle, hike, or walk. The soft, stretchy adjustable waist strap provides a flex-fit for 26”- 41” waists, but the strap can stretch as long as a 47” fit if you don’t mind a tighter fit. The blended strap material is soft and durable with a high quality snap buckle for a secure fit. Wear your belt with the bottles in the back or front. We have found that the belt stays more secure when worn tightly on the waist as opposed to on the hips. However, this hydration running belt will tailor to your comfort. 

BOTTLE REPLACEMENT: Lost or damaged a bottle? No problem, BRINGIT also sells additional water bottles to go with the belt!

OUR PROMISE TO YOU: BRINGIT's mission is to provide you with the best product experience while you “bring it” during your exercise sessions. 100% Money Back Guarantee!

INSTRUCTIONS FOR CARE: Wash bottles before use. Dishwasher safe- top shelf only. Hand wash belt.
feature_bullets: FIT LARGE MOBILE IN WATER RESISTANT POCKET- The 7.5 inches long pocket on this water belt will secure your large mobile phone including the iPhone 6 Plus.
SECURE COMFORT GRIP- The gel-based interior provides grip to prevent chafe and bounce during your long runs. Secure the fuel belt tightly around waist as opposed to low on hips for less bounce.
MORE WATER WITH 10 OZ BOTTLES- 2 pull-top plastic water bottles are secured in neoprene pockets with straps. More water and carry capacity makes it a perfect as a marathon water belt.
ADJUSTABLE FIT ON WAIST- The adjustable belt comfortably fits waists from 25 inches to 40 inches. The belt can stretch up to 47 inches.

EASY PHONE ACCESS, HOLE FOR EARPHONES, and RACE NUMBER ATTACHMENT – The zipper is at the top of the pocket for easier access to materials inside. Also a hole was added for earphone cord. It has straps to attach a race number so it makes a great race number belt or tri race belt.
